article: How to Sell Clothes on ThredUp
intro: ThredUP is a thrifting and shopping site for sustainable fashionistas. Shopping secondhand and selling gently used items are great ways to be an eco-friendly fashion guru. Selling on thredUP is super easy and functions similarly to an in-person thrift store. Simply send in your clothes and thredUP will determine which items they want to list. ThredUP makes selling your clothes easy and ethical, so you can clean out your closet and make some money doing it.

points.name: Preparing Items with a Clean Out Kit

steps.title: After you’ve set your listing price, your item will follow thredUP’s payout timeline.
sub-points: Your item will be available for bids for 12 hours. You will be unable to edit your listing price during this time.
If your item doesn’t sell during bidding, it will be listed for 60 to 90 days, depending on the brand or value. You can adjust your price during this time.
Once your item sells, the buyer has a 14-day return window.
If the buyer does not return the item, your cashout will be available.
If your item doesn’t sell, you can reclaim your item within the last 7 days of the consignment period. Unclaimed items will become the property of thredUP after the consignment window passes.

steps.title: Before sending in your clothes, estimate the amount of money you’ll receive on thredUP’s website.
steps.subtitle: allows you to select the brand and category of your item to get an idea of how much you’ll make.
sub-points: Scroll down to the purple ‘Estimate your payout’ box.
Enter the brand and category of your item.
Click Calculate. This tool will help you set your listing price if thredUP accepts your item.

steps.title: Once an item sells, you can receive your earnings in a few different ways.
steps.subtitle: For all of these options, you have one year to claim your earnings before they are turned into a thredUP gift card.
sub-points: ThredUP Credit. You can use your earnings towards other thredUP purchases.
Stripe. Cashout to your bank via a Stripe account. This option includes a 1.5% plus $0.25 transaction fee.
PayPal. Cashout to your PayPal account. This option includes a 2% transaction fee, but funds are immediately available in your account.
